definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to squeeze the throat/(fig.) to have in a stranglehold/critical
to slit one's own throat/to commit suicide

sentences.english: Don't push me, or I will break your neck.
sentences.chinese: 别欺人太甚，否则我拧断你的脖子。

sentences.english: In one case it began stretching its neck just before the food was delivered.
sentences.chinese: 有一次它在食物送到之前就拉长了脖子。

sentences.english: Its mouth is wide, its neck is narra.
Wear an open shirt, and touch your neck and collarbone.
sentences.chinese: 穿一件开襟衬衫，抚摸自己的脖子和锁骨。

sentences.english: He was mugged from behind and forced into a dark room.
sentences.chinese: 他从背后被勒住脖子，被迫进入一间黑屋。

sentences.english: Seismosaurus had a long neck, a small head and a long thin tail.
sentences.chinese: 地震龙长着长脖子，小脑袋，以及一条细长的尾巴。

sentences.english: At the neck of the wrecked deck, the reckoner checked the opaque cheque.
sentences.chinese: 在遇险的甲板的脖子，计算者检查不透明的支票。

sentences.english: Marius' two arms were passed round his neck, and the former's feet dragged behind him.
sentences.chinese: 马吕斯的双臂围着他的脖子，双足在他后面挂着。

sentences.english: She was wearing a string of cheap pearls about her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她脖子上戴着一串廉价的珍珠。

sentences.english: The audience in the seats craned forward to look at her.
sentences.chinese: 座上的观众伸着脖子看她。

sentences.english: He sprained (strained, wrenched) his ankle by a fall.
sentences.chinese: 他摔了一跤扭了脚脖子。

sentences.english: My debts were like a millstone round my neck.
sentences.chinese: 我欠的债象是在脖子上套着个磨盘。

sentences.english: He shouted at his brother, his neck veins bulging.
sentences.chinese: 他朝他的兄弟吼叫，脖子上青筋暴突。

sentences.english: Attach the ribbon and note to the collar of the cat or dog.
sentences.chinese: 把绳子和便签挂在小猫或者小狗的脖子上。

sentences.english: The deer's neck to long, total high but its head.
sentences.chinese: 鹿的脖子再长，总高不过它的脑袋。

sentences.english: Gently run your nose and lips over her shoulders and neck smelling her. Say "Mmmmm… you smell good."
sentences.chinese: 温柔地让你的鼻子和嘴唇滑过她的肩膀和脖子。

definition: the back (human anatomy)/the back part of sth
